conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the ball: gravitational force, tension, and electric force.
The ball is suspended by a string at an angle θ with mass m and charge q.
Net force on the ball is zero since it is at rest.
Resolve tension into components: vertical (T cos θ) and horizontal (T sin θ).
Vertical equilibrium: T cos θ = mg.
Horizontal equilibrium: T sin θ = qE.
Divide horizontal by vertical equilibrium: tan θ = qE/mg.
Solve for electric field strength E: E = mg tan θ / q.
